title: Injecting chaos into SKT's winning style

replies.body: I'm an SKT fan, but I'm dissapointed that EDG's controlled chaotic style was never mentioned in this article. They are the finished product of when chaos meets order. At MSI, Koro1 was the superior top laner, Deft better than Bang, Meiko having the tournament of his life, and Clearlove significantly better than Bengi atm. They seemed to be able to keep SKT on their toes at all times. Of course when Faker came in, SKT felt secure than mid lane wouldn't lose lane against Pawn (which Easyhoon did twice), but SKT had a lackluster pick ban phase during that series.
Easyhoon didn't lose to PawN, he even beat him in cs and score in the ori game, and cs in the cassi game.... watch the games before you talk about em.

lol..

preaching the "superior SKT-style", and not mentioning EDG's execution of the chaotic style which defeated the former

Yeah it is a bit weird that they have FNATIC as the example of "Chaos" style when EDG is by far the best team playing this "Style" and even defeated SKT who the best at "SKT" style.

Kind of bizarre actually that they fail to mention EDG.
Because that's the only reason they lost right?

Their game 5 win was a result of them baiting faker and SKT into the LB pick. The rest of the team could not accrue leads to cover the fact that there were 5 champions on the enemy team specifically targeted at him. That series was close, but game 5 was won in champ select

Faker did well on LB even with the bait... IMHO it was the Bang-Deft difference... Deft just outperformed Bang on so many levels... Bang at the time wasn't very good... as of recent though he has been a primary carry.
When you play Easyhoon for the first 3 games over Faker, SKT is gonna have a bad time.

The amount of people believing Pawn won over Easyhoon is to damn high.

Pawn had a bad Bo5 in my honest opinon, the reason they won those matches was the incredible skill of their jungler, Clearlove, and of course the rest of the team who won over their counterparts in the enemy team.

I like the SKT style because it's amazing how you can win simply from rotations.

Yeah,  while "chaos-style" relies on your players to be mechanically superior to the opponents, "skt-style" doesn't. A weaker team will have higher chances of winning a game by following "skt-style" than "chaos-style".

Not true at all... the Chaos-Style dos rely on sheer mechanics but that isn't what makes a "better" team. I would argue that perfecting the SKT-Style takes more in-game knowledge, cohesion, practice and overall intelligence. The Chaos-Style works very well against the SKT-Style purely because it is engineered to combat it. The whole point of it is to make it so that the enemy cannot pre-empt your movements, which is the whole premise of the SKT-Style.
